alert.note: Alert for Custer; Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 21 at 7:26PM CST until December 21 at 8:30PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northern Lincoln County in southwestern Nebraska... Southern Custer County in central Nebraska... * Until 830 PM CST. * At 726 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Arnold to 8 miles southeast of Sutherland Reservoir State Recreation Area, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 96 and 99. Highway 2 between mile markers 276 and 289. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 173 and 203. Highway 83 between mile markers 72 and 85. Locations impacted include... North Platte, Broken Bow, Arnold, Callaway, Brady, Maxwell, Berwyn, Lake Maloney State Recreation Area, North Platte Airport, Keith, Westerville, Cottonwood Canyon State Wildlife Management Area, Etna, Milldale, Lodi and Finchville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
